column7: Fancy a booze-up with the lads tonight?

column7: This poor quality diamond has a lackluster surface.

english_phrase: At first I thought there was a child in front of me in the queue but then I saw his face and realized he was a dwarf. / Snow White lived with seven dwarves.

passer sa colère sur [qqn] / évacuer / vider son sac / se défouler / pousser une gueulante
french_phrase: Parfois quand Linda a passé une mauvaise journée au travail elle a besoin de passer sa colère sur quelqu'un (or: d'évacuer sa frustration) quand elle rentre chez elle. / Adam apologised for going on and on about how annoying his colleagues had been that day; he was only venting.
english_phrase: Sometimes
column7: when Linda has a bad day at work
column8: she needs to vent her frustration when she gets home. / Adam s'est excusé d'avoir bassiné tout le monde ce jour-là en parlant de ses collègues énervants ; c'est juste qu'il vidait son sac.

french_phrase: L'incendie a été déclenché par une étincelle provenant du feu. / Tony a rapproché les deux fils
english_phrase: créant une étincelle. / Le mécanicien a inspecté le moteur pour voir si les bougies faisaient des étincelles.
column7: The blaze was started by a spark from the fire. / Tony brought the two wires together
column8: creating a spark. / The mechanic checked the engine to see if the plugs were sparking.

french_phrase: Le roi a demandé à savoir d'où le messager était venu. / Dis moi pieux chevalier d'où venait ta bonne fortune ? / Je viens vous dire adieu d'où ma tenue de cavalière. / Elle était originaire d'Italie d'où ses vêtements aux couleurs gaies.
english_phrase: The king demanded to know whence the messenger had come. / Tell me good knight whence came your good fortune? / I come to bid thee farewell whence my riding-habit. / She hails from Italy whence too her gay apparel.
The children teased Bobby that they could see his peter through his pants.

column7: The doctor said that Alan had brittle bones. / Betty had a brittle grip on reality. / The teacher's voice was brittle with irritation.

french_phrase: Pour Noël Mlle Hendricks nous a offert de la nougatine.
english_phrase: Mrs. Hendricks gave our family some brittle at Christmas.

synonym: strength: fail / speech: be halting / move unsteadily
trad: faiblir (détermination) / fléchir / bafouiller / hésiter / chanceler / vaciller
french_phrase: Fred a tenu le poids au-dessus de sa tête jusqu'à ce que ses bras commencent à faiblir. / Sarah commença à expliquer en quoi elle méritait une augmentation à son chef mais se mit à bafouiller en voyant son expression excédée. / Le cheval a vacillé et a raté son saut.
english_phrase: Fred held the weight above his head until his arms began to falter. / Sarah started explaining to her boss why she deserved a pay rise but she faltered when she saw the angry look on his face.  / The horse faltered and didn't manage to clear the jump.

french_phrase: Emma était furieuse contre l'insulte à son caractère.

english_phrase: The baker shaped the dough and left it to rise. / Sarah rolled the dough and placed it in the flan dish. Dan always keeps a batch of dough in the fridge so that he can make biscuits quickly if he has unexpected guests.

english_phrase: The rope was slack and Malcolm realised Peter must have let go of the other end. / Robert gathered up the slack to pull the rope tight again.

column7: au boulot ! Tu te relâches encore.

french_phrase: The woman wore shoes with very high heels.

english_phrase: He really showed his musical chops on that complex Chopin piece.

english_phrase: The dog tried to break the bone to get at the marrow inside. / Neville won a prize for growing the largest marrow.

french_phrase: Les randonneurs approchaient du sommet de la montagne sous la pluie battante.
english_phrase: The hikers approached the apex of the mountain in the pouring rain.

english_phrase: When Brian was named vice-president he knew he was at the apex of his career.

french_phrase: La brûlure est localisée au niveau de l'apex de la langue du patient.
english_phrase: The burn is on the apex of the patient's tongue.

french_phrase: Le juge fut impitoyable (or: sans pitié) en condamnant les trois prévenus.
english_phrase: The judge was merciless in sentencing the three defendants.

french_phrase: Il a attaché le cheval au poteau. / Il a ficelé le colis avec de la cordelette. / Elle a noué une ficelle autour du paquet cadeau. / Le lien s'est défait et le sac a lâché. / Il reste dans l'Ohio à cause de ses liens familiaux. / La tige de métal permettait d'assembler la structure. / Pour allonger la dernière note de la mesure
english_phrase: on fait une liaison avec la demi-mesure suivante. / Tu préfères des chaussures à lacets ou des mocassins ?
column7: He tied the horse to the post. / He tied the package with string. / She tied string round the giftbox. / The tie came loose and the bag dropped. / He stays in Ohio because of his family ties. / The metal tie helped hold the structure together. / To elongate the last note of the measure
column8: there is a tie to the following half note. / Do you prefer a tie or a loafer?

french_phrase: Les deux équipes ont fait match nul. / Ils ont fait match nul avec le dernier point. / Aucune des deux équipes n'était contente du match nul à 2 partout. / L'équipe canadienne a égalisé dans les dernières minutes du match.
english_phrase: The two teams tied for first place. / They tied the game with the last score. / Neither team was happy with the 2-2 tie. / The two teams were tied in skill. The Canadian team tied the French.

french_phrase: Il a mis une cravate bleue pour aller avec sa chemise blanche.
english_phrase: He wore a blue tie to go with his white shirt.

french_phrase: Comme le portail a sonné à l'aéroport on m'a fouillé.
english_phrase: The police conducted a frisk on the suspect and found drugs.

english_phrase: I've finally decided to take the plunge: I'm getting a tattoo!

english_phrase: Hundreds of people claim political asylum at airports every day.

english_phrase: A buxom serving girl brought him a flagon of ale.

english_phrase: Catherine was furious and her rant went on for several minutes.

english_phrase: Edmund ranted about his colleagues; they'd really been getting on his nerves lately.

english_phrase: Kyle had a nick on his arm from where a rose stem scratched him.
